thread.title: Want Tacos? I Know Where To Get Them! At the...
thread.title_full: Want Tacos? I Know Where To Get Them! At the...

title: Want Tacos? I Know Where To Get Them! At the...
text:
By Judy Hedding Updated July 26, 2016 . 
The Arizona Taco Festival is designed to be a day filled with food, fun and competition. The highlight of the Arizona Taco Festival is the competition, where more than 50 teams will be dishing up specialty tacos in four categories (chicken, beef, pork, and seafood) as well as side dishes for cash prizes and bragging rights. 
In 2015 more than 100,000 tacos were consumed at this event. 
New in 2016: Salt River Fields has added 15 acres of grassy area for special event patrons. When is the Arizona Taco Festival? 
Saturday and Sunday, October 15 and 16, 2016 from 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. Where is it held? 
Salt River Fields at Talking Stick in ScottsdaleGPS: 33.545186,-111.885946 
You can see this stadium location marked on a Google map. From there you can zoom in and out, get driving directions if you need more specifics than mentioned above, and see what else is nearby. 
Parking is free. How do I get tickets and how much are they? 
There is a $12 admission charge when purchased online, $15 at the gate, with children 12 and under admitted free. 
continue reading below our video Tipping Etiquette Around the World A two-day pass is offered online for $20. Food and beverage is a separate charge. Food samples are $2 each. Margaritas, beer, and wine range from about $4 to $12. 
A VIP ticket for $100 includes limited drinks from the VIP bar, taco tokens and private restroom facilities. 
There is an additional $20 charge for 10 samples at the Tequila Expo on Saturday. Choose from over 100 tequilas. 
Admission tickets may be purchased at the gate or in advance online . Additional charges may apply when purchasing online. Are discounts available? 
Not that I know of. What else should I know? 
In addition to visiting the more than 50 teams in taco and sidecart (salsas and such) competition, there will be cooking demonstrations, Lucha Libre wrestling, the tequila expo, live music, hot chili pepper eating contest, taco eating challenge, Kids' Zone and Sunday's Chihuahua Beauty Pageant (registration form online, fee for entry). 
Taco samples are $2 each. Varieties will include chicken, pork, beef, seafood, veggie and dessert. Vendor sample sizes will vary, but should include 1-2 ounces of ingredients. Full plates of food will also available to purchase. 
The Tequila Expo ticket is purchased in addition to the general admission or VIP ticket. Your fee allows you to have ten tequila samples. The hours for the Tequila Expo are noon to 5 p.m. I have more questions!
